content.question: Which of the following best explains why ligase is required for <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> replication?

choices.label: The lagging strand cannot be replicated continuously, and ligase is needed to join the fragments.
Ligase forms the hydrogen bonds between complementary bases in the two strands of <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Ligase facilitates the binding of <math alttext="R N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>RNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> polymerase to the promoter region.
Ligase enables the newly synthesized <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to twist into a double helix.

content.answer: The lagging strand cannot be replicated continuously, and ligase is needed to join the fragments.
